one_reviews_text: One of my favourite racing games ever!
that was lame

These people who are rating the game with bad reviews don't understand that THE GAME DOES NOT SUPPORT CONTROLLER TRACKING. Just look at the controllers the game does support, I enjoy the game personly. So before you start a game read the requirments smh.

Sadly multiplayer is offline but hey it's free and fun for a few rounds!

Also for people saying you can't change your controlls, make sure you change the B button that is set for (cancel) first before you try and change anything. For some reason if you try and change the B button before you set it to something else it cancels out your input.

When I fire it up, once I get to the menu, it doesn't seem to detect my Touch controllers at all, and I can't interact with the game at all. Trying to hit buttons on my keyboard or mouse doesn't work either. And on top of that, this game is ugly as frak. Looks like something originally made for the PS-2. I get it's a couple years old now, but I can buy better-looking pre-made assets off the Unity store for almost nothing. In fact I have.

Really glad this thing was free, otherwise I'd be annoyed. Not even going to waste my time trying to get it to work, uninstalling it.

This game is fun but my God does it cause motion sickness.  No other game that I play in VR causes me issues but this one makes me ill almost instantly.  Perhaps it’s the fixed camera angle combined with the fast movement that is weird for me but I would not recommend this title to anyone who has had motion sickness in the past.
Simple graphics and gameplay, akward controls and interface, just feels like a weekend DEV side-project that made it into my library.

review_title: Oculus sais my computer doesnt meet.
one_reviews_text: basic standards or requirements  to run vr.  I have not had a problem yet with any game or app on here or steam.  Good game though.
Cannot remap controls (as far as I know) which is an immediate 1 star for me. Can't use my joystick or racing wheel.

With a wheel and a vr headset, controls are totaly unusable:
Brake to up and down in menu
Wheel to right and left...
incredible...
This is a simple racing game with simple controls and simple mechanics.

This is a great game if you want to stare at the menu screen and listen to the music. Other than that it's completely broken. Can't use my Rift S controllers, Xbox controller, or G29 wheel, since the game doesn't register any of them.
I had to re-map some controls in the options, and multiplayer is offline. But its free and a great time killer :)

review_title: Enjoyed the game but not many players
one_reviews_text:
I've been enjoying the game but there aren't enough players for multi-player.  I can't find a discord or online discussion anywhere.   I don't get why so many VR games are focusing on multi when there are so few players.
This game requires ranking in multi to unlock new stuff but you can't rank if nobody is playing.
A shame really since it's a fun game.
This has become my go to vr game. Extremely immersive. Crank the visuals up to high for a real treat.
So I bought it. And am not disappointed. A great game, very immersive and fun, and great graphics.

I'm afraid I'm coming at this game after playing Redout. I hate to review a game by mentioning another but here's what Redout is: Fast, colorful, amazingly designed tracks, challenging levels to practice and learn.

Here's what Radial-G is: sluggish, monochromatic, boring tracks, easy levels with no real desire to play again until you get it perfect. 

When you turn it just kind of lumbers in the direction. No real split second thinking and timing. 

The graphics are pretty terrible, all things considered. 

I can't recommend this when there are so many great options out there.

I purchased this while at work, and was looking forward to getting home and trying it out. Unfortunately as other reviews have stated it still doesn't work with touch.
Hopefully development fixes this soon so it's not just a waste of money and space on my hard drive.

This game is fun.  There are some problems with execution related to porting I think...  

It reminds me of the 3DO era, specifically a game called, "Crash n Burn" where like Radial G I had a great time despite the obvious flaws...

Despite what you've read in other reviews, I can assure you touch controllers are supported, kinda.  My hope is that there will be an update soon...  You see, the touch controllers aren't supported in the menus, so you have to lift off your Rift to use the arrow keys on the keyboard to explore the menus, then once it's go time you have to put the Rift back on.  There is no way to know "what does what" on the touch controls so you just have to figure it out.  A major flaw is that the devs seem to have been so happy that they got it working that they didn't put much thought into the mapping of the buttons.  For instance, to fire your weapon you have to take your thumb off the stick that STEERS YOUR CRAFT.  So in a game where split second decisions are critical, you have to stop steering long enough to fire then quickly go back and hope to course correct.  FIXXXXXXX ITTTTTTT!

There are lots of redeeming qualities though!  Definitely some throwback charm of like F-Zero and "Crash n Burn".  There's some FAST action and some great visuals.  I like it, but why U NO FIX PROBLEMS?  Looking forward to some polish!

This is a very good futuristic racing game! The addition of circular tracks is awesome. This allows 360º rotation, jumps, and gravity flips, perfectly fitted into the game, and with no motion sickness! It also has weapons for attacking other racers (but it lacks a tutorials explaining what each weapon does, you need to discover it by testing them one by one).
I was a bit dubitative to buy it due to people complaining that Touch controller were not working, but in my case they worked flawlessly (and also I changed the controller layout of touch and the configuration was saved even after closing and reopening the game). In my case I have never had any other gamepad connected to the PC except for touch, so maybe having a controller connected to the PC makes the game not work with Touch

review_title: Awesome racing game - a must have!
one_reviews_text:
Awesome racing game, and worked perfectly using Touch - but you can also use a gamepad.

I enjoyed the game so much I felt bad about not paying for it - so I just bought the game on Steam but don't plan to ever install it, it was just 10 bucks.
The game feels slightly like Polybius, WipeOut and maybe some Trailblazer.

The game performed great with super-sampling (SS) at 2.0 and graphics on medium on my overclocked GTX 1080, 16GB PC3200 and i7 7700K, I did not notice any frame dropping (I'm just guessing, graphics on high seemed just to activate anti-aliasing and you don't need that with SS 2.0, so with SS 2.0 I didn't notice any difference between medium and high except some frame dropping using high).
review_feedback: Hi there, the game used to support Touch gamepad emulation without issue, we are looking into what's gone wrong. Thank you for your patience whilst we investigate. You can help us by sending the output log file from the _data folder in the game folder

review_title: Very cool but NO TOUCH recognized?!
one_reviews_text:
This is a very cool Pod Racer (sue me, I'm a Star Wars fan) clone. Brilliant feel of speed and even on KEYBOARD controls it plays pretty fine.
But advertising Touch support while there's no Touch setting nor recognition?
I mean WTF is this? Buttons and sticks, the full Touch controls are DEAD and there's no settings in the controls menu?

Come on people, fix this or imma have to get a refund because keyboard controls in VR is for noobs...
review_feedback: Hi there, the game used to support Touch gamepad emulation without issue, we are looking into what's gone wrong. Thank you for your patience whilst we investigate. You can help us by sending the output log file from the _data folder in the game folder

review_title: It works flawlessly on my Rig
one_reviews_text:
I have no Problems what so ever, it is fast realy fast!! I like the graphics well done.
I can Play on my Xbox controller and on the Oculus Touch. If this Game had any ciontroller issues in the past than they are gone by now. I bought it Today the 06.03.2018 played it for 3 hours straight and love it :D 

does the game make false advertisment? No! you get what you expect it makes the racing in a galaxy far far away look like Kindergarden.

good work and well spend 9.99 Euros.

Radial-G is great!
First, the graphics are stunning, and it stands out even more in VR (as usual). Besides, the environment is dense and dynamic!
The game really feels like F-Zero : it's a race game with a sci-fi atmosphere!
I don't really like the steam-punk music, luckily the options allow you to cancel it : I use Itunes to play my own music while I play this game.

As a race game, it may not be the best : it's kind of linear as the vehicle mostly follows the road by itself. That said, it is still quite technical : you have to use your knowledge of relative speed to avoid the "red doors" (which gives you damage if you pass them), and you can also transform your Shield (basically, this is your HP) in Speed, and many weapons can be used to attack the other competitors!
Besides, it really gives great sensations of speed, and overall, it's super immersive!

In terms of content, it's not bad for a VR game, though we could argue it's still not quite enough. 9 races, about as much weapons, and as much vehicles, and the many modes all consist of the same thing : being first to finish the race.

Despite this, personally, it's among my favourite games in VR. I just wish there were more people to play with (I tried Multiplayer several times, and I always wound up alone xD!).

I rarely review games, but this sucks. Despite what it may say, this title does not seem compatable at all with Touch. The most I could get it to do was spin the ship on the first menu screen that shows up. So I broke down and used the XBO controller for the first time (My feeling is that if it's not Touch compatible, it's probably not worth playing in VR because the immersiveness is gone). 
The game isn't really very fun, it's just irritating. The tutorial videos are so fast that you don't even have time to read them before it's on to the next random video. A woman is constantly yelling "WARNING!" in my ear... why? No idea. Low shields or something. It would have been a better idea to have her yell what the warning actually was for. The vehicle dashboard is a mess of who-knows what. None of it is labeled and it isn't obvious what any of it is. Everything going on in front of you is so busy anyways that you don't have time to glance down. A HUD would have been a much better idea so you don't have to look down. 
The track seems to like to throw you off of it and there is no obvious way to land correctly. So you die. Again and again. But, suprisingly, you still make it to the finish line and remember it was a race, not just a gauntlet... and all I can think of is that I came in second place after dying multiple times during the race. Second place. Playing that horribly in any other racing game would send you to last place. Just how bad is the AI on the NPC's if that warrants second place?!

I've only played four races and I honestly could care less if I played it again. The developers seriously need to go play Nitrous Oxide for the Playstation 1 because that game did this better in almost every way.  Ugh. I really hope there are plans to update this game because it feels unfinished, rushed and almost soul-less.

this game is pretty kick a$$, however the touch controls are broken at the moment, but with the xbox contoller its still a pretty good game. awesome soundtrack and decent replayability. needs a larger community for online play.

I have many fond memories of playing "anit-grav" racers back in the 90's, and this totally brings the feeling back in an awesome way!

As a side note, I didn't experience any motion sickness with this whatsoever, although I am for the most part immune to that. Still, I sorta expected my stomach to get a little unsettled with super highspeed spinny racing and I was perfectly fine!
Extremely sloppy game!After 5 minutes delete!!!

As others have said gameplay is extremely repetitive. Also spawns after crash will immediately spawn you to crash again over and over. I feel the potential here, beautiful game with some fun mechanics.

I've had this game for about a year now. If you love future sci-fi fast paced arcade racing action to some German sounding techno music, this game is for you. There are plenty of tracks to race on and multiple race modes to compete in.  Buy this for the single player experience.

F-Zero was easily my fav game as a kid, following by extreme-G in terms of racing games.  This game here makes me very happy I have a rift right now.  Now to learn how to suck less at racing 20 years later.
Dis be da game i be playing a lot
Great visuals, great music, love the environments and overall comfort level even though it is very fast paced. Best fast-paced racing game on VR so far.

review_title: Seems cool at first, but gets old fast
one_reviews_text:
While this game gives you a good sense of speed, it fails at everything else. The core to this game's problems is the tracks. Not only do they all look the same, they all feel the same. Thanks to most of the tracks being made of a tube that you ride the outside of, you are almost never challenged. It changes up on occasion, but you spend most of your time on these tubes that take NO SKILL to navigate. You can simply not steer when these tubes curve and you will just follow the track. You probably won't be on the best side of the track after the turn, but it doesn't change the fact this game requires no cornering skills at all. The only things you really have to worry about are barriers you can run into, easy to dodge btw, and the rare moments where you can fall off the track. One of the greatest things about a good racer is learning the ins and outs of the tracks and mastering them. These tracks are so easy to master that they all feel like the same track which ends the fun way too quickly. If the devs bothered to at least make different looking settings (all the tracks are in space, so there is no terrain, buildings, etc, just a boring sky box with stars and maybe some asteroids), then I would at least have something to look forward to every time I unlocked a track.

The bottom line is don't get this game unless it's for $5 or less, and even then I have a hard time recommending it.

The tracks are largely uninteresting, the combat is unispired, and even though you're moving fast, you don't really feel it.  It's fun for a few hours if you're new to racing games, but otherwise it simply feels empty. You feel like you're alone on the track once the pack widens.

It's not that bad a game, it just feels like every aspect of it never quite got to where it wanted to be. Not worth the price.

I have two questions for you. 
gotta go fast?
dont get motion sick?

then welcome to one of the most exillerating titles in VR to date. this is one of the more unique racing titles ive come across in my time. instead of your typical race track, you have a pipeline that you cruise, blast, launch and jump across at such breakneck speeds even a vet like myself gets a bit woozy from the sharp turns. see you on the line!

review_title: A VR F-ZERO, but easy motion sickness
one_reviews_text: If you can handle "intense" rated games, and if you like F-ZERO style racers, than this is for you. I love the genre, but unfortunately in VR it makes me sick. Not the game's fault, I don't think--I just can't handle it :(

Do you remember the old classic game for N64:  Star Wars Episode I: Racer?
Because I do, and my dream for VR was a game which filled that same role.
Let me tell you, THIS GAME DOES.
The intense high-speed twitch-reflex style racing is exactly what I was hoping for!
The tracks are incredibly fun; racing on a cylindrical track with the awesome G-force physics make the game tricky to master and incredibly satisfying.
I couldn't reccomend this game enough!
It would be cool to get more tracks, but the provided ones (9 of them) are tons of fun.
The only complaint I have is that there are not many people online to race against... so buy this game and RACE ME! :D
F-Zero GX (Gamecube) styled controls, with Wipeout styled surroundings. Havn't played the game a whole lot yet but so far it's solid in terms of gameplay, graphics, music, and controls.

It's a fun little future racer. I usually kill the ingame music and put on a youtube video in the background to get the classic SNES F-Zero tunes. Maybe they should add the option to play locally stored music? Oh, and there's noone ever online for racing. Strange since others say the same thing. Aren't we able to see each other? Maybe the devs should look into this?
for this Game and it's tooooo slow...
High paced racing without the nausa.
its ok but after a few hours its boring no online players available.
